intro: Elatinoides spuria var. racemigera, commonly known as the racemifera elatinoid, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Elatinaceae. It is characterized by its small, succulent leaves and clusters of tiny, white or pale pink flowers. The plant is typically found in moist, sandy soils in coastal or saline environments. It has a short life cycle, often completing its growth and reproduction within a single growing season. Due to its delicate structure and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
